item.title: Apple Vision Pro: Apple's first spatial computer
item.description: - Apple has unveiled the Apple Vision Pro, a spatial computer that seamlessly combines digital content with the physical world, incorporating a fully three-dimensional user interface controlled by a userâ€™s eyes, hands, and voice.

item.title: Our right to challenge junk patents is under threat
The Rust I wanted had no future
item.description: - Former lead developer of Rust, Graydon Hoare, reveals significant differences between the Rust language as it exists today and the Rust he originally envisioned.

item.title: Google no longer automatically indexes websites?
item.description: - Google is no longer automatically indexing new websites as they used to in the past.

item.title: Tell HN: My Reddit account was banned after adding my subs to the protest
item.description: - The post details how a user added their subreddits to a protest for racial justice and was subsequently banned from the platform for violating community guidelines.

item.title: SEC Sues Binance & CEO Zhao for Breaking US Securities Rules
item.description: - The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has sued Binance Holdings Ltd.

item.title: GPT Best Practices
item.description: - The post provides strategies and tactics to improve results from GPT models, including clear instructions, reference text, task splitting, "thinking" time, external tools, and systematic testing.

item.title: Generative AI learning path
item.description: - The Generative AI learning path is a curated collection of content on Generative AI products and technologies.

item.title: Sandstorm: Open-source platform for self-hosting web apps
item.description: - Sandstorm is an open source platform for self-hosting web apps that allows users to host productivity apps securely.

item.title: Apple unveils new Mac Studio & brings Apple Silicon to Mac Pro
item.description: - Apple has announced the release of new Mac Studio and Mac Pro, featuring M2 Max and M2 Ultra, respectively.
